item.title: 联邦政府关门加剧特区经济困境
item.description:
长期休假或解雇可能会加剧首都地区的经济放缓。【原文：

A prolonged period of furloughs — or firings — could worsen a slowdown for the capital region.

】

item.title: NBF 的马里昂称加拿大赤字将激增至 720 亿加元
item.description: 加拿大的一家主要贷款机构称，加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）将把该国的赤字推高至约占国内生产总值的 3%，因为他的政府正在推行重大项目并试图吸引更多投资。【原文：One of Canada’s major lenders says Prime Minister Mark Carney will push the country’s deficit to about 3% of its gross domestic product as his government pursues major projects and tries to attract more investment.】

item.title: 摩根大通牵头为 Qualtrics 交易提供 50 亿美元贷款融资
item.description: 据知情人士透露，摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. is leading a roughly $5 billion loan financing to support Qualtrics International Inc.’s purchase of health-care survey firm Press Ganey Forsta, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 拉加德认为加强欧元基础可带来持久益处
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）呼吁各国政府努力将欧元转变为真正的全球货币，使该地区的经济蓬勃发展。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde appealed to governments to work toward turning the euro into a truly global currency that will allow the region’s economy to thrive.】

item.title: 甲骨文因报告称其云业务利润率低于预期而下挫
item.description: 甲骨文公司（Oracle Corp. ）发布报告称，该软件制造商云计算业务的利润率低于华尔街许多人的预期，导致该公司股价暴跌。【原文：Oracle Corp. shares tumbled after a report that the software maker’s profit margin in its cloud computing business is lower than many on Wall Street have been estimating.】

item.title: 德国央行行长敦促默茨加速经济改革
item.description: 德国联邦银行行长约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，德国政府必须加大力度解决经济的深层次问题，提高经济增长潜力。【原文：Germany’s government must step up efforts to tackle the economy’s deep-seated problems and increase its growth potential, Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel said.】

item.title: 关于当下发生的事情的七点思考
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. item.title: 英国金融监管机构面临债券磁带拍卖存在缺陷的指控
item.description: 英国金融行为监管局正面临指控，称其债券数据项目的拍卖过程因技术问题和利益冲突而有失公平。【原文：The UK’s Financial Conduct Authority is facing allegations that its auction process for a bond data project was unfair because of a technical issue and conflict of interest.】

item.title: 温克艾沃斯的双子座公司首次公开募股（IPO）陷入低谷后，市场反应冷淡
item.description: 双子座空间站公司（Gemini Space Station Inc.）在 9 月份上市后的几天内就抹去了首次公开募股的收益，分析师们只提供了适度的支持，并在他们的初始报告中警告说，这家加密公司面临着日益激烈的竞争和盈利能力不足的问题。【原文：Gemini Space Station Inc. wiped out gains from its initial public offering within days of its September debut, and analysts are offering only modest support, warning in their initiations of coverage that the crypto company faces increasing competition and a lack of profitability.】

item.title: 米兰认为美联储双重目标的紧张程度低于同行
item.description: 美联储理事斯蒂芬-米兰（Stephen Miran）说，他不认为央行的两个目标之间会像他的一些其他决策者那样紧张。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran said he doesn’t see as much tension between the central bank’s two goals as some of his fellow policymakers do.】

item.title: 交易商关注美国农业援助，大豆期货走高
item.description: 周二，大豆价格上扬，原因是市场猜测美国农场救助计划的前景可能有助于增强生产商的财务状况并阻止作物抛售。【原文：Soybean prices ticked up Tuesday on speculation that the prospect of a US farm bailout could help bolster producer finances and stem crop selling.】

item.title: 在行业反弹之后，京东计划对稳定币上限进行分拆
item.description: 英格兰银行计划对企业持有稳定币的拟议限制给予豁免，这表明在来自美国的竞争日益激烈的情况下，英格兰银行对加密资产的态度有所软化。【原文：The Bank of England plans to grant exemptions to proposed limits on stablecoin holdings by businesses, indicating a softening stance toward cryptoassets amid growing competition from the US.】

item.title: 荷兰合作银行首席利率策略师麦奎尔离职 15 年
item.description: 据荷兰合作银行发言人称，该行利率战略主管理查德-麦奎尔（Richard McGuire）已离开荷兰合作银行。【原文：Richard McGuire, head of rates strategy at Rabobank, has left the Dutch lender, according to a spokesperson for the bank.】

item.title: 爱尔兰将削减基金税以支撑资本市场
item.description: 爱尔兰财政部长帕夏尔-多诺霍（Paschal Donohoe）在周二的预算中宣布，爱尔兰将把基金产品投资的税率从 41% 下调至 38%。【原文：Ireland will reduce the rate of tax on investment in funds products from 41% to 38%, Finance Minister Paschal Donohoe announced during the budget Tuesday.】

item.title: 纽约联储调查显示，消费者认为未来一年通胀率将上升
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行的一项月度调查显示，消费者认为未来一年通胀率将上升，有迹象表明中低收入家庭承受了价格上涨压力的大部分负担。【原文：Consumers see higher inflation in the year ahead, with signs that lower and middle-income households are feeling most of the burden of rising price pressures, according to a monthly survey from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.】

item.title: 纽约市商业集团推选泽西城市长富洛普为下一任首席执行官
item.description: 泽西市市长史蒂文-富洛普（Steven Fulop）被任命为纽约市合作伙伴关系的下一任首席执行官，该组织是代表银行、房地产公司、律师事务所和其他大型雇主的有影响力的贸易团体。【原文：Jersey City Mayor Steven Fulop has been named the next chief executive officer of the Partnership for New York City, the influential trade group representing banks, real estate companies, law firms and other large employers.】

item.title: 捷克大选获胜者称赤字可能扩大以资助优先事项
item.description: 据上周末议会选举的获胜者称，由于即将离任的政府计划用于一系列优先支出的资金不足，捷克共和国的下届政府可能需要增加预算赤字。【原文：The Czech Republic’s next government may need to increase the budget deficit as the outgoing administration planned insufficient funding for a range of spending priorities, according to the winner of last weekend’s parliamentary election.】

item.title: 乌克兰无人机袭击推动俄罗斯石油出口激增
item.description: 乌克兰无人机对俄罗斯炼油厂的袭击激增，削减了俄罗斯国内的原油加工量，导致莫斯科的原油出口激增。【原文：A surge in Ukrainian drone attacks on Russia’s oil refineries has cut processing crude at home and led to a surge in Moscow’s crude exports.】

item.title: 联邦存款保险公司（FDIC）计划力求将美国银行监管重点重新放在重大风险上
item.description: 美国联邦存款保险公司（Federal Deposit Insurance Corp.【原文：The Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. unveiled a plan to narrow the way examiners can issue warnings to lenders, saying it wanted to refocus bank supervision on core financial risks.】

item.title: 贝莱德最赚钱的 ETF 是近千亿美元的比特币巨头
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. ）以其 ETF 基金而闻名于世，其基金涵盖了近 20 年来的各种行业和主题。但是，贝莱德最新推出的产品中，有一项是最赚钱的。【原文：BlackRock Inc. is known the world over for its ETF suite, with funds spanning all manner of industries and themes going back nearly two decades. But one of its newest offerings is its most profitable.】

item.title: 人工智能发电热潮将推动美国公用事业电网支出达到 1.1 万亿美元
item.description: 据行业组织爱迪生电气研究所（Edison Electric Institute）称，2025 年美国电力公司将在电网上花费近 2080 亿美元，未来五年将超过 1.1 万亿美元。【原文：US electric companies will spend almost $208 billion in 2025 and more than $1.1 trillion over the next five years on the power grid, according to industry group Edison Electric Institute.】

item.title: 千禧年投资组合经理 George Klavdianos 退出对冲基金
item.description: 据知情人士透露，千禧管理公司（Millennium Management）高级信贷投资组合经理乔治-克拉夫迪亚诺斯（George Klavdianos）已离开该公司。【原文：George Klavdianos, a senior credit portfolio manager at Millennium Management has left the firm, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 贝莱德的新赌注将公司置于人工智能和能源阵营的中心位置
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. 是全球最大的基金管理公司，拥有超过 12.5 万亿美元的客户资产。【原文：BlackRock Inc., the world’s largest money manager with more than $12.5 trillion in client assets, is expanding its empire to stake a bigger claim in the artificial-intelligence boom and the energy markets fueling it.】

item.title: Verizon 调整预示着对新客户的竞争将更加激烈
item.description: 争夺新移动电话和宽带用户的竞争将变得更加激烈。【原文：The competition for new mobile-phone and broadband customers is about to get a lot nastier.】

item.title: 印度莫迪在与普京通话中重申与俄罗斯的关系
item.description: 根据南亚国家政府的一份声明，印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪和俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京重申了进一步深化两国 "特殊而优越的战略伙伴关系 "的承诺。【原文：India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Russia’s President Vladimir Putin reaffirmed their commitment to further deepen the “special and privileged strategic partnership” between the two countries, according to a statement from the South Asian nation’s government.】

item.title: 雪佛龙任命道达尔能源公司高管领导勘探改革
item.description: 雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.）任命来自道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）的凯文-麦克拉克兰（Kevin McLachlan）领导其全球勘探团队。【原文：Chevron Corp. appointed Kevin McLachlan from TotalEnergies SE to lead its global exploration team, which is undergoing a revamp after several high-profile failed attempts at discovering oil and gas.】

item.title: 据称 Marlin 将考虑以 20 亿美元出售瑞典科技公司 Medius
item.description: 知情人士透露，马林股权合伙公司（Marlin Equity Partners）正在考虑出售瑞典软件公司 Medius。【原文：Marlin Equity Partners is considering a sale of Swedish software company Medius, which could be valued at about $2 billion in a deal, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 目前与人工智能相关的高等级债务达 1.2 万亿美元，超过了银行
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：The amount of debt tied to artificial intelligence has ballooned to $1.2 trillion, making it the largest segment in the investment-grade market, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: S&P 500 指数走高，交易员等待美联储议长的利率提示
item.description: 周二，美国股市悄然走高，创下自五月以来的最佳连胜纪录。政府停摆已进入第七天，投资者的目光已不再关注政府停摆，与人工智能相关的公告继续推动科技股走高。【原文：US stocks crept higher on Tuesday to trade at record levels following their best winning streak since May. Investors are looking past the government shutdown, which is entering a seventh day, as announcements tied to artificial intelligence continued to propel technology shares higher.】

item.title: 乌克兰在袭击浪潮后寻求将天然气进口量提高 30
item.description: 乌克兰表示，在俄罗斯加强对关键能源基础设施的攻击后，乌克兰将不得不增加近三分之一的天然气进口。【原文：Ukraine said it will have to ramp up natural gas imports by almost a third after Russia intensified attacks against key energy infrastructure.】
